channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: OpenAI Launches Cheaper Subscriptions, Starts Testing Ads Because It’s Time to Pay the Piper
item.description: The inevitable is beginning.

item.title: X is fully online after going down for most of the morning
item.description: X seems to be working again after struggling with an outage that took the service offline and made it slow to load for much of the morning. According to X’s developer platform page, there is an ongoing incident related to streaming endpoints that’s caused increased errors. The incident started at 7:39AM PT, according to the page.That roughly coincides with a spike in reports at Down Detector. The issues seemed to be somewhat intermittent. At some points, X’s website loaded partially and only showed older posts. At other times, the app and website failed to load at all. As of 9:30AM PT, X’s Ex...

item.title: Trump’s Tariffs Just Opened the Door for Chinese EVs in Canada
item.description: Our neighbors to the north are slashing tariffs on Chinese EVs as tensions with the U.S. continue to rise.

item.title: Snowflake, Databricks challenger ClickHouse hits $15B valuation
item.description: The $400 million round was led by Dragoneer.

item.title: I played the Nintendo DS game threatening Clair Obscur: Expedition 33’s Metacritic ranking — here’s how it went
item.description: I played the Disney game threatening Clair Obscur: Expedition 33’s top Metacritic ranking — is it actually good?

item.title: Google is appealing the ruling from its search antitrust case to avoid sharing data with rivals
item.description: Google has filed its appeal to the Department of Justice’s antitrust case that ended with a federal judge ruling that the company was maintaining a monopoly with its search business. While the company goes through the appeals process, it’s also asking that implementation of the remedies from the case, which include a requirement that Google share search data with its competitors, also be paused.“As we have long said, the Court’s August 2024 ruling ignored the reality that people use Google because they want to, not because they’re forced to,” Google said in a statement. “The decision failed to...

item.title: Anthropic (an AI Company) Warns That AI Will Worsen Inequality
item.description: It's a shame it's being forced at gunpoint to build the inequality machine.

item.title: Marvel Seems Pleased With How Those ‘Avengers: Doomsday’ Teasers Did
item.description: The four clips got over a billion views online, mostly from Instagram and TikTok instead of YouTube.

item.title: Satellites Capture the Hidden World Beneath Antarctica’s Ice
item.description: A new map of the landscape beneath the continent's ice sheet reveals a previously undiscovered terrain.

item.title: Your ChatGPT is about to get ads — here's what you need to know and how to opt out
item.description: After countless rumors, OpenAI has confirmed that ads are coming to ChatGPT and they'll be a part of conversations. Here's how they will work and how you can opt out.

item.title: Good news! RAM prices seem to have finally stabilized - bad news, it's probably because memory prices are so high, that it's forcing most of us to give up buying anything
item.description: DDR5 prices surged dramatically in late 2025, then stabilized at extreme levels as buyers resisted further increases in high-capacity kits.

item.title: The Best Videos of ICE Agents Eating Shit in the Brutal Minneapolis Winter
item.description: Watch out for that ice, you fascist clowns.

item.title: Do you use ChatGPT’s free version? It now has a major catch
item.description: OpenAI said Friday it will start including ads for its free model, as well as its cheapest subscription, ChatGPT Go. OpenAI, the maker of ChatGPT, said on Friday it will start including ads for those who use the app for free, or have the cheapest subscription, ChatGPT Go.

item.title: TikTok quietly launches a microdrama app called ‘PineDrama’
item.description: Think TikTok, but every single video you come across is a short episode of a fictional story.

item.title: Our Favorite Compact Power Station Is on Sale for 33% Off
item.description: This little power station can keep your stuff topped up, plus you can save some cash on solar panels.

item.title: Wall Street holds near records amid rising geopolitical tensions
item.description: Technology stocks were the strongest forces behind the market’s moves. Stocks wavered in afternoon trading on Wall Street Friday as the first week of corporate earnings season closes out with markets trading near record levels.

item.title: These cheap JBL earbuds offer all-day battery life and cost less than $30
item.description: The JBL Vibe Beam are a super-cheap pair of earbuds that offer excellent battery life — and they're now down to a great low price on Amazon.

item.title: The northern lights could be visible in more than a dozen U.S. states this weekend
item.description: The projected viewing line stretches from Washington state to Maine. The northern lights could light up the skies above several northern states this weekend.

item.title: Trump and Mid-Atlantic governors want tech companies to pay for new power plants
item.description: The Trump administration and a bipartisan group of governors are pressuring the PJM Interconnection, the biggest electricity market in the US, to hold a power auction meant to spur a massive buildout of new power plants. Together, they're "urging" PJM to hold an "emergency" auction for companies to procure electricity over 15-year contracts. The unusually […]...

item.title: EPA rules that xAI’s natural gas generators were illegally used
item.description: Elon Musk's AI company had installed and operated 35 natural gas turbines without permits, something the EPA now says was illegal.

item.title: I Love That Holly Hunter Can’t Sit in a Chair Normally on ‘Starfleet Academy’
item.description: Hunter's new 'Star Trek' captain is taking the Riker maneuver to a whole new level of chair-clambering.

item.title: Elon Musk Is Really Mad That Ryanair’s CEO Doesn’t Want Starlink on His Planes
item.description: “I would pay no attention whatsoever to Elon Musk. He's an idiot. Very wealthy, but he's still an idiot.”

item.title: Wavlink WL-UTD58 review: this sleek Thunderbolt 5 dock upgraded my studio setup, but there’s one thing missing
item.description: The Wavlink WL-UTD58 is a premium Thunderbolt 5 docking station and an ideal solution for anyone working in the creative sector. The dock features a good selection of ultrafast Thunderbolt 5 ports, offering fast data delivery and 140W PD, making this a great choice for both laptop and desktop use.

item.title: Meet the Sam’s Club CEO tasked with taking on Costco
item.description: Sam’s Club has named Walmart veteran Latriece Watkins as its new CEO. Meet the new CEO of Sam’s Club: Latriece Watkins.

item.title: Actors fight back as AI deepfakes become scarily accurate
item.description: As performers seek to AI-proof their careers, Matthew McConaughey is taking a unique (and legal) approach to protecting his likeness. During the Hollywood strikes of 2023, a major sticking point for members of the Writer’s Guild of America and SAG-AFTRA was artificial intelligence. When the unions ultimately came to an agreement with Hollywood studios, they won key protections for actors regarding digital replicas and guardrails for how generative AI could be used in writers’ rooms. ...

item.title: Trump wants Big Tech to pay for new power plants as electricity prices surge
item.description: The Trump administration is urging PJM Interconnection to require tech companies to fund new electricity generation. The data centers that power the AI boom also need power themselves – and a lot of it. Now, the Trump administration wants the tech companies cashing in on AI to foot a bigger part of the bill.
